member.summary: Provides a delegate that performs an atomic update of a key/value pair

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.KeyValuePredicate`2

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.ICreateValue`2
member.summary: An interface to provide conditional or custom creation logic to a concurrent dictionary.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.ICreateValue`2.CreateValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Called when the key was not found within the dictionary to produce a new value that can be added. Return true to continue with the insertion, or false to prevent the key/value from being inserted.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IUpdateValue`2
member.summary: An interface to provide conditional or custom update logic to a concurrent dictionary.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IUpdateValue`2.UpdateValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Called when the key was found within the dictionary to produce a modified value to update the item to. Return true to continue with the update, or false to prevent the key/value from being updated.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.ICreateOrUpdateValue`2
member.summary: An interface to provide conditional or custom creation or update logic to a concurrent dictionary.
member.remarks: Generally implemented as a struct and passed by ref to save stack space and to retrieve the values that where inserted or updated.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IRemoveValue`2
member.summary: An interface to provide conditional removal of an item from a concurrent dictionary.
member.remarks: Generally implemented as a struct and passed by ref to save stack space and to retrieve the values that where inserted or updated.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IRemoveValue`2.RemoveValue(`0,`1)
member.summary: Called when the dictionary is about to remove the key/value pair provided, return true to allow it's removal, or false to prevent it from being removed.

member.summary: Extends the IDictionaryEx interface to encompass concurrent/atomic operations

Constructs a new value for the key.

member.summary: Adds a key/value pair to the if the key does not already exist, or updates a key/value pair if the key already exists.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IConcurrentDictionary`2.AddOrUpdate(`0,System.Converter{`0,`1},ClearScript.Manager.Caching.KeyValueUpdate{`0,`1})
member.summary: Adds a key/value pair to the if the key does not already exist, or updates a key/value pair if the key already exists.
member.remarks: Adds or modifies an element with the provided key and value. If the key does not exist in the collection, the factory method fnCreate will be called to produce the new value, if the key exists, the converter method fnUpdate will be called to create an updated value.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IConcurrentDictionary`2.AddOrUpdate``1(`0,``0@)
member.summary: Add, update, or fetche a key/value pair from the dictionary via an implementation of the interface.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IConcurrentDictionary`2.TryAdd(`0,System.Converter{`0,`1})
member.summary: Adds an element with the provided key and value to the by calling the provided factory method to construct the value if the key is not already present in the collection.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.IConcurrentDictionary`2.TryUpdate(`0,ClearScript.Manager.Caching.KeyValueUpdate{`0,`1})
member.summary: Modify the value associated with the result of the provided update method as an atomic operation, Allows for reading/writing a single record within the tree lock. Be cautious about the behavior and performance of the code provided as it can cause a dead-lock to occur. If the method returns an instance who .Equals the original, no update is applied.

member.summary: Conditionally removes a key/value pair from the dictionary via an implementation of the interface.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder
member.summary: Defines if and how items added to a LurchTable are linked together, this defines the value returned from Peek/Dequeue as the oldest entry of the specified operation.

member.name: F:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder.None
member.summary: No linking

member.name: F:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder.Insertion
member.summary: Linked in insertion order

member.name: F:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder.Modified
member.summary: Linked by most recently inserted or updated

member.name: F:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder.Access
member.summary: Linked by most recently inserted, updated, or fetched

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2
member.summary: LurchTable stands for "Least Used Recently Concurrent Hash Table" and has definate similarities to both the .NET 4 ConcurrentDictionary as well as Java's LinkedHashMap. This gives you a thread-safe dictionary/hashtable that stores element ordering by insertion, updates, or access. In addition it can be configured to use a 'hard-limit' count of items that will automatically 'pop' the oldest item in the collection.
member.typeparam: The type of keys in the dictionary.
The type of values in the dictionary.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.ItemUpdatedMethod
member.summary: Method signature for the ItemUpdated event

member.summary: Event raised after an item is removed from the collection

member.name: E:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.ItemUpdated
member.summary: Event raised after an item is updated in the collection

member.name: E:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.ItemAdded
member.summary: Event raised after an item is added to the collection

member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that can store up to (capacity) items efficiently.

member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that can store up to (capacity) items efficiently.

member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that can store up to (capacity) items efficiently.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.#ctor(ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that orders items by (ordering) and removes items once the specified (limit) is reached.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.#ctor(ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that orders items by (ordering) and removes items once the specified (limit) is reached.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.#ctor(ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LurchTableOrder,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Creates a LurchTable that orders items by (ordering) and removes items once the specified (limit) is reached.
member.param: The type of linking for the items
The maximum allowable number of items, or int.MaxValue for unlimited
The number of hash buckets to use for the collection, usually 1/2 estimated capacity
The number of entries to allocate at a time, usually 1/16 estimated capacity
The number of concurrency locks to preallocate, usually 1/256 estimated capacity
The element hash generator for keys

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.Peek(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Retrieves the oldest entry in the collection based on the ordering supplied to the constructor.
member.returns: True if the out parameter value was set.
member.exception: Raised if the table is unordered

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the oldest entry in the collection based on the ordering supplied to the constructor. If an item is not available a busy-wait loop is used to wait for for an item.
member.returns: The Key/Value pair removed.
member.exception: Raised if the table is unordered

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.TryDequeue(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Removes the oldest entry in the collection based on the ordering supplied to the constructor.
member.returns: False if no item was available
member.exception: Raised if the table is unordered

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Caching.LruCache`2.TryDequeue(System.Predicate{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}},System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Removes the oldest entry in the collection based on the ordering supplied to the constructor.
member.returns: False if no item was available
member.exception: Raised if the table is unordered

member.summary: Options for execution of of scripts by the Runtime Manager

member.summary: Objects to inject into the JavaScript runtime.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.ExecutionOptions.HostTypes
member.summary: Types to make available to the JavaScript runtime.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.ExecutionOptions.AddToCache
member.summary: Indicates that this script should be added to the script cache once compiled. Default is True.

member.summary: Indicates the duration that a script should be cached.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.ExecutionOptions.Scripts
member.summary: External JavaScripts to import before executing the current script.

Member to retrieve.
member.returns: The requested property value.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.Loaders.RequiredPackage.ScriptUri
member.summary: A script URI of a package javascript. The export from the package is returned from the require call.

member.summary: Host types needed for the package.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.Loaders.Requirer

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.Loaders.Requirer.Require(System.String)
member.summary: Called via a javascript to require and return the requested package.

member.summary: Called via a javascript to require and return the requested package.
member.param: ID of the RequirePackage to require.
A script uri. This is only needed if the packageId doesn't meet the script convention name and the package is not a registered package.
member.returns: The return object to use for the require. Either the export from the require script or the returned HostObject if not script is present.

member.summary: This code is appended to the created code.

member.summary: Sets the script Id if it is not set.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.HostObject
member.summary: A specific object instance to inject into the javascript to execute.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostObject.Name
member.summary: Name of the object used to access the object in the JavaScript.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostObject.Flags
member.summary: HostItemFlags to apply to the HostType. Limits the scope of the type and which type members are available. See ClearScript documentation for more information.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostObject.Target
member.summary: The target object to inject into the JavaScript.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.HostType
member.summary: A type to make available in JavaScript.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostType.Name
member.summary: Name of the type that is used to reference the type within the JavaScript.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostType.Flags
member.summary: HostItemFlags to apply to the HostType. Limits the scope of the type and which type members are available. See ClearScript documentation for more information.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostType.HostTypeCollection
member.summary: Host type collections provide convenient scriptable access to all the types defined in one or more host assemblies. They are hierarchical collections where leaf nodes represent types and parent nodes represent namespaces. See ClearScript documentation for more information.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.HostType.Type
member.summary: An individual type to make available to the script.

member.name: T:ClearScript.Manager.IRuntimeManager
member.summary: Runtime Manager used to execute scripts within a runtime.

member.name: P:ClearScript.Manager.IRuntimeManager.AddConsoleReference
member.summary: If True, automatically adds a reference to the .Net Console.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.IRuntimeManager.ExecuteAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.ClearScript.V8.V8ScriptEngine},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the provided script.
member.param: Id of the script for caching purposes.
Script text to execute.
An action that accepts the V8 script engine before it's use and configures it.
Indicates that this script should be added to the script cache once compiled. Default is True.
member.returns: Task to await.

member.name: M:ClearScript.Manager.IRuntimeManager.ExecuteAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{ClearScript.Manager.HostObject},System.Collections.Generic.IList{ClearScript.Manager.HostType},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the provided script.
member.param: Id of the script for caching purposes.
Script text to execute.
Indicates that this script should be added to the script cache once compiled. Default is True.
Objects to inject into the JavaScript runtime.
Types to make available to the JavaScript runtime.
member.returns: Task to await.

member.summary: Executes the provided script.
member.param: A list of include scripts to run.
An action that accepts the V8 script engine before it's use and configures it.
Options to apply to script execution. HostObjects and HostTypes are ignored by this call.
member.returns: Task to await.

Options to apply to script execution. HostObjects and HostTypes are ignored by this call.
member.returns: Task to await.

member.summary: Compiles the provided script.
member.param: Id of the script for caching purposes.
Script text to execute.
Indicates that this script should be added to the script cache once compiled. Default is True.
Number of seconds that the V8 Script will be cached.
